snippet.textDisplay: “21 Years” is a song I wrote about the recent passing of my firstborn son, Truett Foster McKeehan. I loved him with all my heart. Until something in life hits you this hard, you never know how you will handle it. I am thankful that I have been surrounded by love, starting with God’s and extending to community near and far that have walked with us and carried us every day. Writing this song felt like an honest confession of the questions, pain, anger, doubt, mercy and promise that describes the journey I’m probably only beginning. The rest is yet to come. One thing I know is that I am not alone. God didn’t promise us a life of no pain or even tragic death, but He did promise He would never leave us or forsake us. And I’m holding dearly to that promise for my son as well as myself.
snippet.textOriginal: “21 Years” is a song I wrote about the recent passing of my firstborn son, Truett Foster McKeehan. I loved him with all my heart. Until something in life hits you this hard, you never know how you will handle it. I am thankful that I have been surrounded by love, starting with God’s and extending to community near and far that have walked with us and carried us every day. Writing this song felt like an honest confession of the questions, pain, anger, doubt, mercy and promise that describes the journey I’m probably only beginning. The rest is yet to come. One thing I know is that I am not alone. God didn’t promise us a life of no pain or even tragic death, but He did promise He would never leave us or forsake us. And I’m holding dearly to that promise for my son as well as myself.

snippet.textDisplay: That last line gave me the chills
snippet.textOriginal: That last line gave me the chills

snippet.textDisplay:
*LYRICS*

[Verse 1]
Woke up 'cause the light poured in
Day two, let the flood begin
Day one left me in my bed (In my bed)
I can barely remember it
Heart shattered in a thousand ways
They tell me pain gonna come in waves
They tell me I'm gonna be okay
I'm still waitin' for the first to break

[Pre-Chorus]
Why would You give and then take him away?
Suddenly end, could You not let it fade?
What I would give for a couple of days
A couple of days

[Chorus]
Is it just across the Jordan?
Or a city in the stars?
Are you singin' with the angels?
Are you happy where you are?
Well, until this show is over
And you run into my arms
God has you in Heaven
But I have you in my heart
I have you in my heart

[Verse 2]
I just can't make sense of this
Everything is so dissonant
Somebody said he was meant for this
But I'm just straight missin' him
I wanna wake up to your laugh at two
Catch you when you steal my shoes
Say good mornin', afternoon
Talk you through those "Alex blues" (Alex blues)
Listen to your latest beats
Talk about what the lyrics mean
Venmo you another loan (Another loan)
See you do your second show

[Pre-Chorus]
You said you'd turn, you would turn it around (Turn it around)
Thought that you had time to straighten it out (Straighten it out)
Told me that you were my prodigal son
But this isn't home

[Chorus]
Is it just across the Jordan?
Or a city in the stars?
Are you singin' with the angels?
Are you happy where you are?
Well, until this show is over
And you run into my arms
God has you in Heaven
But I have you in my heart
I have you in my heart

[Bridge]
Did he see You from a long way off (Did he see you?)
Runnin' to him with a father's heart? (Runnin' to him)
Did You wrap him up inside Your arms
And let him know that he's home?
Did he see You from a long way off
Runnin' to him with a father's heart?
Did You wrap him up inside Your arms
And let him know that he's home?
Oh, oh, oh, oh

[Chorus]
Is it just across the Jordan?
Or a city in the stars? (City in the stars)
Are you singin' with the angels?
Are you happy where you are? (Happy where you are)
Well, until this show is over
And you run into my arms (Run into my arms)
God has you in Heaven

[Outro]
21 years makes a man full-grown
21 years, what a beautiful loan
21 years, I love every one
Thank You, Lord, for my beautiful son

snippet.textDisplay: I'm five years older than you TM and have listened to your songs since DCTalk.  The level of spiritual maturity you have displayed is remarkable. snippet.textDisplay: I'm so sorry for your family's loss. Grieving is a process. My family still misses my younger brother tremendously and he died in 1995. But God is so wonderful in easing pain. God understands loss completely. When days get hard and pain and regret seem unbearable, always remember that God is very near to the broken hearted.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm so sorry for your family's loss. Grieving is a process. My family still misses my younger brother tremendously and he died in 1995. But God is so wonderful in easing pain. God understands loss completely. When days get hard and pain and regret seem unbearable, always remember that God is very near to the broken hearted.

snippet.textDisplay: When the Scripture says that he gave his only begotten Son,shows the love of a God who loves us more than we understand. I'm thank for your testimony. It made me stop and appreciate the time and what I have with my son. Even though he gets on my nerves (TEENAGER) But Im grateful. He was diagnosed with type 1 when he was a 11ys old and we almost lost him. His blood sugar was 900. But the grace of god. Dont know your pain but understand as a father we want them to go beyond us. Thank u for your ministry. Rev 12:11 -We overcome by the Blood of the Lamb and the words of our Testimony

snippet.textDisplay: Keeping you and your family in prayer brother. While we've never met you were instrumental in my adoption into our Heavenly Father's family. I raised 4 daughters following your music, testimony and example of how to be a man, husband and father in this fallen world. You have set a wonderful example what it means to be a child of God. And now in spite of going through  such a potentially soul shattering event, you again show us how to worship through grief. May God bless and keep you my friend.
snippet.textOriginal: Keeping you and your family in prayer brother. While we've never met you were instrumental in my adoption into our Heavenly Father's family. I raised 4 daughters following your music, testimony and example of how to be a man, husband and father in this fallen world. You have set a wonderful example what it means to be a child of God. And now in spite of going through  such a potentially soul shattering event, you again show us how to worship through grief. May God bless and keep you my friend.

snippet.textDisplay: Takes a lotta strength to vocalize the loss of family.  Just wanna take time to say to Toby , we are all with you . From your days of DC Talk to forever,  we are praying with you, for you . Your song Just Need You really transformed my life . And brought me closer to God than ever before.  Even with tears in my eyes and as a father imagining my own daughter , my only child.  I hold her closer to me and love her and tell her daily . My heart goes out to you. Only God knows the purpose and reasons but please know Toby that we are all standing by you and sending our prayers and love to you and your family.  My tears beginning to fall hard now , but be encouraged , you are not alone brother . . . We will all help you thru it
snippet.textOriginal: Takes a lotta strength to vocalize the loss of family.  Just wanna take time to say to Toby , we are all with you . Only God knows the purpose and reasons but please know Toby that we are all standing by you and sending our prayers and love to you and your family.  My tears beginning to fall hard now , but be encouraged , you are not alone brother . . . We will all help you thru it

snippet.textDisplay:
Toby, my grandson and I have loved your music since he was old enough to understand the lyrics in songs. He is 9.5 years old and dreams of being at one of your concerts someday. My lil’ man can dance like no other to your creations. Our hearts are saddened by your great loss. Our prayers are ever with you and your family! We love you Brother! I leave this comment with one you stated after losing Truett....
"We don’t follow God because we have some sort of under the table deal with Him, like we’ll follow you if you bless us. We follow God because we love Him. It’s our honor."
"He is the God of the hills and the valleys," TobyMac said. "And He is beautiful above all things."
THANK YOU TOBY! Thank you for bringing honor and glory to our ELOHIM!!! Sharri

snippet.textDisplay: God Bless you Toby and your Family. I understand where you are in your loss. My youngest son passed 2003. God was my refuge my hope. I heard someone say..He just gone up a little bit higher is all. I know that God held me and breathed for me. You are right, God has him and you have him in your heart and soul, he is a part of you. Look forward to that Wonderful Great union day, my friend. God is holding your heart. Love

snippet.textDisplay: My hear breaks for you. My 30 year old son died suddenly in December 2016. I feel your pain, your questions, your anger, and your love. I hope someday to feel peace. I lean on my faith, I question my faith, and I despise my God who would let this happen, but through this tragedy my faith is the only rope I can cling to. God bless you and your family. We have to believe our sons are in the arms of our Lord and singing in the angel's choir.
snippet.textOriginal: My hear breaks for you. My 30 year old son died suddenly in December 2016. I feel your pain, your questions, your anger, and your love. I hope someday to feel peace. I lean on my faith, I question my faith, and I despise my God who would let this happen, but through this tragedy my faith is the only rope I can cling to. God bless you and your family. We have to believe our sons are in the arms of our Lord and singing in the angel's choir.

snippet.textDisplay: So many questions we have in grief. Some say “don’t question God.” But I think sometimes our questions are statements of faith. We still believe, but we hate that this life is sometimes painful. What a beautiful and honest song and video that expresses what so many feel. God be with you Toby and your family too.
snippet.textOriginal: So many questions we have in grief. Some say “don’t question God.” But I think sometimes our questions are statements of faith. We still believe, but we hate that this life is sometimes painful. What a beautiful and honest song and video that expresses what so many feel. God be with you Toby and your family too.

snippet.textDisplay: One of my favorite songs of all times is WHAT IF I STUMBLE from Dc Talk... at the very end of this song they say YOU ARE MY CONFORT AND MY GOD... that is what kept me living one day at the time,we’re going through a very sad and hard situation in our lives now,and I know how it feels when someone you love is not around you anymore, but we’re clinging to God,we’re still repeating YOU ARE MY CONFORT AND MY GOD.

snippet.textDisplay: TobyMac, I am a fellow grieving parent. On May 12, 2016, my beautiful son, Evan suddenly ran ahead to Heaven at the age of 21 years, 3 months, and 8 days. God has used your music to minister to me during difficult times for more than 2 decades but none like this. I’m so sorry that you & your wife know this pain but I am so grateful for this raw, honest, heart breaking song...and I know many other grieving parents are as well. May God comfort us all until they run into our arms again. ❤️💔❤️
snippet.textOriginal: TobyMac, I am a fellow grieving parent. On May 12, 2016, my beautiful son, Evan suddenly ran ahead to Heaven at the age of 21 years, 3 months, and 8 days. God has used your music to minister to me during difficult times for more than 2 decades but none like this. I’m so sorry that you & your wife know this pain but I am so grateful for this raw, honest, heart breaking song...and I know many other grieving parents are as well. May God comfort us all until they run into our arms again. ❤️💔❤️

snippet.textDisplay: Beautiful tribute for your precious son, Toby, I am praying for you and your wife right now. My heart goes out in empathy to you both and your pain. I lost my baby firstborn son, Noah, many years ago, and it was the most excruciating pain ever. Now that I have teens, I cannot even imagine how much worse it must feel. The questions, the cries of pain, anger, the agony, the tasteless food, the frustration that the world is still going about its business as if part of the sun didn't just die out, it's harsh in the beginning. God can handle our honesty with Him. I remember God putting a comforting thought in my head that He had one arm around me and one around my son in heaven in the same embrace, so we weren't really so far apart after all, both seeking comfort in our Father's hug. Hard to believe, but it really does get better over time. Life slowly starts to come back. One day you discover that you remember what joy feels like for the first time in a long time, and you may experience a mixture of relief and guilt that you could even feel it again, but then you remember that your child would want you to feel joy and that your God loves you and wants you to live the best version of life He has for you until you all meet again in heaven. You find ways to make it have meaning as you help others in similar situations through the worst pain of their life and point them towards Jesus. Toby, you've already started doing that kind of ministry by putting it into your songs and posts, encouraging people in the Lord. Well done. Before my son Noah died, I had bought a CD by Michael W. Smith, and it was laying in the console of my car, unopened. On the way home from my first day back to work after losing him, I was so depressed driving home, wondering if he was in heaven, if I'd see him again, looking for some comfort, and I looked over, saw the CD, and popped it in. Partway home, a song came on I'd never heard before called "Noah, Hello, Goodbye" which was a song about a parent losing his young son came on, and it was like he was singing my heart right then. I had to pull the car over because the tears made it impossible to see, and I knew that God had known before my son died that I'd need to know in this moment that faith was worth it, that we'd be in heaven together someday, and God made sure I bought that CD ahead of time for this very moment. It gave me peace that God truly is sovereign over all things, even the things we can't understand, and Michael W. Smith helped me and countless others in that ministry. I am sure God will use you in much the same way for those going through similar young adult child losses over the coming years. Thank you for standing strong against the tide, brother. Praying for you as you carry on, one foot in front of the other, soldier, brother in Christ. Even in my nonfamous life, there were many eyes watching me to see how I'd handle the losses of life in light of Christ, and in your case there are many more. I've seen many people repost the little encouragements you've put up on FB since your loss. You and the memory of your precious son, Tru, are affecting lives through this difficult tragedy already. Here's the Noah song link in case you'd like to hear it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sz73tafcUjI
snippet.textOriginal: Beautiful tribute for your precious son, Toby, I am praying for you and your wife right now.  My heart goes out in empathy to you both and your pain.  I lost my baby firstborn son, Noah, many years ago, and it was the most excruciating pain ever.  Now that I have teens, I cannot even imagine how much worse it must feel.  The questions, the cries of pain, anger, the agony, the tasteless food, the frustration that the world is still going about its business as if part of the sun didn't just die out, it's harsh in the beginning.  God can handle our honesty with Him.  I remember God putting a comforting thought in my head that He had one arm around me and one around my son in heaven in the same embrace, so we weren't really so far apart after all, both seeking comfort in our Father's hug.  Hard to believe, but it really does get better over time.  Life slowly starts to come back.  One day you discover that you remember what joy feels like for the first time in a long time, and you may experience a mixture of relief and guilt that you could even feel it again, but then you remember that your child would want you to feel joy and that your God loves you and wants you to live the best version of life He has for you until you all meet again in heaven.  You find ways to make it have meaning as you help others in similar situations through the worst pain of their life and point them towards Jesus.                            Toby, you've already started doing that kind of ministry by putting it into your songs and posts, encouraging people in the Lord.  Well done.  Before my son Noah died, I had bought a CD by Michael W. Smith, and it was laying in the console of my car, unopened.  On the way home from my first day back to work after losing him, I was so depressed driving home, wondering if he was in heaven, if I'd see him again, looking for some comfort, and I looked over, saw the CD, and popped it in.  Partway home, a song came on I'd never heard before called "Noah, Hello, Goodbye" which was a song about a parent losing his young son came on, and it was like he was singing my heart right then.  I had to pull the car over because the tears made it impossible to see, and I knew that God had known before my son died that I'd need to know in this moment that faith was worth it, that we'd be in heaven together someday, and God made sure I bought that CD ahead of time for this very moment.  It gave me peace that God truly is sovereign over all things, even the things we can't understand, and Michael W. Smith helped me and countless others in that ministry.  I am sure God will use you in much the same way for those going through similar young adult child losses over the coming years.  Thank you for standing strong against the tide, brother.  Praying for you as you carry on, one foot in front of the other, soldier, brother in Christ.  Even in my nonfamous life, there were many eyes watching me to see how I'd handle the losses of life in light of Christ, and in your case there are many more.  I've seen many people repost the little encouragements you've put up on FB since your loss.  You and the memory of your precious son, Tru, are affecting lives through this difficult tragedy already.    Here's the Noah song link in case you'd like to hear it:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sz73tafcUjI

snippet.textDisplay: Toby, first I am so sorry for the loss of your son. Secondly, thank you for writing such a honest and "real" song. I love your attitude! There is hope in Him -- He is the Living Hope!! BTW, we literally just played this song/video last night at our church for our high school kids. We have a group that meets every Sunday evening at our church that is just for our high school crew. I could visually see that several of the kids were touched by this story. Truett may no longer be here physically, but you're keeping the memories alive! Peace to you brother. In the mighty name of Jesus, Amen.

snippet.textDisplay: I am so sorry for your loss, Toby Mac. I too know the pain of losing a child,  and I pray that you have no anger or resentment in your heart, as I did at one point. Your music, along with other artists, really helped me get through my dark period. Hey, maybe if you are in Greensboro, North Carolina one day, maybe we could chat over a meal, and reflect on our angel children? My treat!

snippet.textDisplay: I'm a year removed from losing my daughter of 22 years. She had a seizure in her sleep and passed after a 7 year battle with Hashimoto's Encephalopathy. I've been a sailor for 24 years and have watched my brothers and sisters die in battle, but nothing has hit me like losing her. My faith, my wife and my youngest daughter are the only things that have kept me going. This is a beautiful song that has really helped me with the struggle to carry on.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm a year removed from losing my daughter of 22 years. She had a seizure in her sleep and passed after a 7 year battle with Hashimoto's Encephalopathy. I've been a sailor for 24 years and have watched my brothers and sisters die in battle, but nothing has hit me like losing her. My faith, my wife and my youngest daughter are the only things that have kept me going. This is a beautiful song that has really helped me with the struggle to carry on.

snippet.textDisplay:
I’ve wrestled with my faith for years- the older I get the more things seem like they don’t make sense. The more questions I have that I don’t have the answers to, but
somehow this song is healing. You can see To doesn’t understand, but trusts anyway. I’ve always been afraid of being brainwashed- to be duped. We are supposed to challenge everything like Paul days, but there has to be some sort of balance, because I don’t think I can ever know why God does or allows some of the things he does.

The point is seeing Toby surrender his understanding is helping me put down my walls of needing to know.

snippet.textDisplay: This song brings tears to my eyes. We cry for your pain Toby, and we rejoice that our God is a loving Father, and your son is in His loving arms. There are people out there praying for you and your family. Thanks for years of pouring out your joy and now for sharing your pain. We grieve for you...and pray for our abundant God to bring peace that surpasses all understanding to you and your family.
